channel.title: Problem with the world today
channel.description:
Nah this is small problem compared to the real world problems but this video is funny because all this punk as bitch keeps saying is "fucking lawsuit" "im going to sue you" etc... is that what we do today? waste the courts time with shit like this, every-time a little fucking problem arises the first thing people do is sue someone, that fucking kid got the short end of what he really deserved, getting his ask kicked
Anyways discuss what you would have liked to see happen in this video
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RYVUb3i3GSo

item.title: Problem with the world today
item.dc:creator: @mormonman mormonman
item.description:
@mormonman wrote:

Did anyone else bust up about the dude saying “reach up my jacket”?

Stupid white guy. Dumb idea to pick a fight with a 200+ lb black guy. So stupid. Makes me ashamed to be white.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with the world today
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I assume the guy said something offensive. But the bouncer should know better, people who are drunk lose all self control and won’t back down. If the guy was sober, he’d understand after the first push that he’d stand no chance against the bouncer.

But (threatening to) suing people for no reason has been going on for years, it’s nothing new.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with the world today
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

[quote=“tL, post:2, topic:437612”]While I think he didn’t have to push him as many times as he did, it is important to remember that it was the guy who kept getting pushed over that was walking up to him and carrying it on. If the guy in the red actually had intentions of harming him, he would have done much more than push him.

I think he’d be fine, perhaps an informal warning on trying to keep a little more calm and not getting too involved or personal.[/quote]

I agree, the whole pushing started when the guy tried to walk past both of the bouncers, but as you said the red bouncer let that guy get to him and made it more personal than it had to be

Read full topic

item.title: Problem with the world today
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

While I think he didn’t have to push him as many times as he did, it is important to remember that it was the guy who kept getting pushed over that was walking up to him and carrying it on. If the guy in the red actually had intentions of harming him, he would have done much more than push him.

I think he’d be fine, perhaps an informal warning on trying to keep a little more calm and not getting too involved or personal.

Read full topic
